features: Never loses suction or power.Specific uses:Stairs,Furnitures.Amperage : 4.2 amps
Cleans Bare Floors and Deep Cleans Carpets
body.description: Product Description This Never Loses Suction, Never Loses Power vacuum cleans as well as an upright without all the weight of one! It cleans bare floors and deep cleans carpets. Swivel steering provides the ultimate control to get in and around obstacles and furniture. The versatility of this vacuum allows for floor to ceiling cleaning. Use the wand to reach high above or between narrow spaces. Use the handheld like a hand vac to clean stairs and furniture. The slim design is also great for cleaning under furniture. Includes a crevice tool, pet hair tool, dusting brush and Dust-Away with microfiber pad. This corded vacuum is portable and easy to store. Durable Product. Brand Story By Shark

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars THE SHARK ROCKET, baby!!
reviews.reviewText: I don't believe in sales. But let me tell you something. I would be a fulltime salesperson for the Shark Rocket! 10 stars out of 5! Here are the reasons I love my Shark Rocket, in random order:1. Sucks hard, trustworthily2. Comes with a selection of helpful attachments3. Easy to dump and clean the container4. Easy to clean the filter pads5. Relatively lightweight - I have horrible back problems and this is a breeze6. No bags! The heck with bags. Save the environment. Dump the nasty contents of your vacuuming adventures directly into the trash.7. The pole! You can hold the vacuum like a flamethrower! Get the spiderwebs off your ceiling with ease! Get into any corner! Onto any surface! No stupid floppy hose! Just use the pole to obliterate all of your gross corners.8. Great price! You'll have this vacuum for years and years.9. Simple, uncomplicated. A doorknob could immediately figure out how to use this vacuum.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Unstoppable Machine, Vacuum Cured My Depression
reviews.reviewText: You're reading reviews for this vacuum because you have two concerns: hair and weight. Consider your problems solved.First, hair. As you can see from the attached image, I have the kind of long, extremely thick hair that strangles vacuum rollers dead in nanoseconds. This vacuum's roller has a groove carved into the plastic so you can quickly and easily slide a knife or scissor blade in, severing every hair with no hassle. Instant cleanup, no destroyed roller.The suction is no joke. There are two settings: one that is as powerful as my old vacuum on max power, and one that is TURBO CHARGED. This will demolish ground-in dirt and hair even from high-pile carpet or rugs. The suction is so powerful, even carpeting and rugs that have been pounded completely flat have the fibers physically pulled upwards, so even if your hairy little monster of a pet likes to destroy carpet or rug fibers, after vacuuming they feel plush and wonderful. Con: on Turbo mode, you will smell burning hair. The motor really is not kidding around and will set itself on fire before it allows the tiniest speck of dirt to remain on your floor.Second: weight. It's remarkably lightweight and very easy to heft around even with tiny elf arms. The maneuverability of the vacuum head is excellent and can work around such tight unwieldy places as between chair legs. All the pieces pop apart and reassemble with no trouble, so storage and transportation will never be an issue. Con: almost all of the weight is in the top handle, where the motor is. This can make it a tiny bit difficult to get the vacuum head to stay on the ground properly, and makes it nigh impossible for you just to stand the vacuum up anywhere and leave it there. Being top-heavy does it no favors.General design con: the canister is somewhat small and connected directly to the motor so you can't just pop it out, empty it into a bin, and pop it back into the vacuum. It's very easy to empty, but you are still going to have to heft the motor around with it, and the motor is obviously still going to be plugged into the wall. Good news is that the motor/handle/canister all pops free of the other bits with a simple lever press, so it's not like you need to carry the entire vacuum with you when you head to the bin.Bonus pro: there are a huge number of attachments, heads, and specialty bits and bobs in with the vacuum. I don't know what half of them are used for. Some are obviously for cleaning off stairs, or ceiling fans, or getting into crevasses, but some of them, who even knows. Literally whatever kind of application you'd like this vacuum for, there's probably a specialized nozzle for it. This is the cleanest my stairs have been in four years.Final pitch: look, I get it. I have a A Thing about money where no matter how worthy a purchase it is, a triple digit price tag makes me flinch. I put off getting a new vacuum for months and watched my own mental health spiral, knowing a contributing factor was that I was living in rising masses of dirt and grime. Danger had its element, too; a pie plate exploded (don't ask) and glass shards found themselves all over my kitchen floor, and some ended up in my feet. No vacuum to clean up the shards I couldn't see and couldn't get up with a broom and dustpan. I know being surrounded by painful messes we're powerless to fix is a 2020 mood and all, but this metaphor is a little too on the nose. I caved and bought the vacuum. I cranked her up this morning. This is the best I've felt in months. I know the price tag is a little steep compared to other lightweight vacs, but it's powerful and versatile enough that it's absolutely worth the expenditure.If you're looking for a worthwhile vacuum that will demolish human hair, pet hair, ground-in dirt, and particulates from any flooring you could possibly have, all while staying under $200, this is it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic!!! Buy this sweeper!!
reviews.reviewText: I originally bought a Tineco battery sweeper. I wanted something light weight to do a quick sweep everyday. I have two dogs and three kids. As soon as I bought the Tineco A11 pet vacuum I was not impressed. Decided to keep it and it totally stopped working with 3 weeks. This shark was 1/3 of the cost I wasn’t expecting much. This is awesome! I only have carpet in 1 room. I bought a regular vacuum for that room. Thinking this would not be great for deep cleaning or carpet! I was wrong!! It got so much out of my carpet. Worked a million times better than the Tineco!!! I was worried about the cord and wanted light weight to take upstairs. The cord is long and not an issue! Buy the one with the cord!!! I changed the batteries in the other one twice and still couldn’t sweep one level of my house. This clearly has more power and can handle pet hair. Works perfect on the couch! The grip on the handle is nice! It’s easy to get around and maneuvers well. It actually sucks up pet hair!! I’m very impressed and I’m super picky. I actually don’t even think I need the standard vacuum anymore bc this works so well. However, I will probably end up keeping it bc I’m so impressed with this shark sweeper that I’m not disappointed about ordering both! Don’t underestimate this! I bought two vacuums for the price of the original one I purchased and this one surpassed my expectations!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Cleans well; heavy at the top
reviews.reviewText: My biggest problem with this stick vac is the heavy motor at the top. Makes it unwieldy to maneuver and hard on the back to operate. Some of the big, burly guys doing review videos mention that it's light weight. Assuming their estimate of 8 lbs, that's heavy when it's in the top location.Power switch is conveniently located and well labeled.It seemed to do a pretty good job cleaning relatively low pile carpet and tile.The roller was not overly tangled with hair. More hair in the bin, which was extremely easy to empty and clean out.No printed manual in the box. I download manuals anyway. There is no wall bracket included. I looked through all the packaging 3 times. The there is a handy bracket at the bottom that holds the heavy motor section, which is very easy to move down. Balances the vac for easy storage.For me (80/f) the awkward weight is a significant design flaw.

I have a Shark vac for the downstairs area & I really like it. It's amazing what these vacuums pick up, both embarrassing & happy. The only thing I don't like is that the dirt cup isn't removable for cleaning like my older one. I have a Hoover vacuum that does a great job but it's heavy & especially cumberson on the stairs.The price was totally awesome & I'm happy with it. I highly recommend.
HASTA EL MOMENTO NO TENGO NADA MALO QUE DECIR, ASPIRA SUPER BIEN, SOLO QUE ESTA UN POCO CHICO EL DEPOSITO PERO FUERA ESO ESTOY FELIZ CON ELLA
Facil de utilizar muy comoda, remplaza al 100% a una escoba convencional, ideal para aspirar diario en lugar de barrer y mover el polvo de un lado a otro. EXCELENTE

I did a lot of research before buying this vacuum and I’m very glad to say it has lived up to expectations.The suction on this is incredible and I find it very easy to use to get dust on baseboards and furniture. I’ve vacuumed so much more since I’ve gotten this. The storage cup is small so you will have to empty it regularly, but I don’t mind as I usually have a trash can near by to do that. I live in a condo so I’m also not covering a lot of space.I will agree with other reviewers and say it is heavy on the wrist, which might be too much for some. I work a physical job though and am a young mom so it only took me a few days to get use to and now I barely notice or care.The biggest selling feature to me is the fact that it stands to store. I didn’t want to have to mount a vacuum on one of my walls and so that more than anything sold me on this model. The second suction level does an incredible job on my rugs and with two cats and two kids that’s a big plus too.For anyone worried about cord length, I can reach my from the front entrance of my condo all the way to the back of the living room (+35ft) with ease from a single plug in the middle. So unless you have a huge house or a closed off layout you should be able to do at least 2-3 rooms.Over all if you’re comfortable handling the weight of it I would 100% recommend this vacuum.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very disappointed RE SELL DAMAGED STOCK.
reviews.reviewText: I purchased a vacuum cleaner and once delivered after opening the box it was like parts just chucked loose into the box. After plugging it into the power outlet and turning the unit on it stopped working. the body of the vacuum cleaner felt very hot just after a few...
